Translations.Text: The leading ones from among his people – who disbelieved, and denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and to whom We granted ease and comfort in the life of this world – said: "This is but a mortal like you, eating of what you eat of, and drinking of what you drink of
If you obey a mortal like yourselves, then you will surely be the losers
Does he promise you that, after you have died and become mere dust and bones, you will be brought forth (to a new life)
Far-fetched, utterly far-fetched, is what you are promised
There is no life beyond our present, worldly life. Some of us die (while others are born,) and so life continues; and we are not raised from the dead
He is nothing but a man, fabricating falsehood in attribution to God; and we are not (going to) to believe in him
Eventually, the Messenger invoked: "My Lord, help me because they deny me
(God) said: "In a little while, they are sure to be regretful

So in consequence, the awful blast seized them as a judgment of God rightly fitted to their deserts, and We made them like the waste of dead plants carried by a flood and left on the coast once the water recedes. So away with the wrongdoing people
Then, after them, We brought forth new generations (in succession)

(What happened to all those generations proves that) no community can ever hasten on the end of its term, nor can they delay it (once it has been decided by God because of their beliefs and life-styles)

We sent Our Messengers one after the other (each to a generation). Whenever their Messenger came to a community, they denied him, and in consequence We caused each community to follow the other to its doom, and reduced them to mere tales of the past. So away with a people who do not believe

After all those Messengers (sent to the past generations that are now all extinct,) We sent Moses and his brother Aaron as Messengers with Our clear signs (miracles to support them) and a manifest authority (from Us)
To the Pharaoh and his chiefs. But they grew arrogant in the face of them, and demonstrated that they were a haughty, self-exalting people
They said: "Shall we believe in two mortals like ourselves, when their people {the people of Moses and Aaron) are serving us in humility and obedience
They denied them, and they too eventually became of those who were destroyed
(After their destruction) We granted Moses the Book so that his people might follow the right way
We made the Son of Mary and his mother a miraculous sign (of Our Lordship and Power), and We provided for them refuge on a lofty ground of comfort and security with a (water) spring
